titleStmt.title: D. C. Briggs et al. to Beriah Magoffin

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Logan county Kentucky Feb 11th 1861
To His Excelency the Governor of Kentucky

Whereas Summerset Cooksey of Logan county Ky has been fined fined in two cases in the Cir Criminal Court of Said County the fines were assessed Some ^the charge was for selling liquor^ two or three years ^ago^ but have not been paid off. Mr Cooksey is an Aged and verry infirm man. And the Sheriff now threatening to put him in the county Jail for the fines. We therefore Humbly pray you to Reprieve Remit the fines together with the costs we believe it would be an act of Justice as well as Mercy
Respect We therefore Respectfully pray you to give the Case due Consideration with as little delay as possible the fines amount to $120.

Names
D. C. Briggs
G. N. Baugh
S, B, Morgan
John Booker
G C Penrod
B. Watkins
A Y Smith
S M ^his X mark^ Penrod
R. A. Whitescarver
